Subjective: Dizziness for 3 days. Onset: waking up. Light-headed feeling. Room spinning. Meds: None. Negatives: No trauma, no radiation to neck/arm, no numbness/tingling, no vomiting, no pain in head, no hearing loss, no speech difficulties. Social: No smoking, no alcohol, no drug use. ICE (Concern): Worried about brain tumour.
Objective: BP: 110/70. HR: 62. Neuro: Normal follow-through movement. HIT test: Negative on both sides. Vestibular system: Crystals in vestibular system, possibly shifted. Physical exam: Benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV) symptoms provoked.
Assessment: Benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV). Ruled out: Brain tumour.
Plan: Explanation of BPPV. Epley manoeuvre to help alleviate symptoms. Instructions via thuisarts.nl. Perform manoeuvre at home. Follow-up: Physiotherapist or doctor can perform manoeuvre. Safety net: Contact if symptoms worsen or do not improve.
